cont.entity_a: The keyboard software can cause display issues when switching display modes.

The fingerprint reader is very slow, taking about 20 seconds to respond. The fingerprint logon works on Vista but doesn't recognize banking sites. The fingerprint reader is reliable and handy. The fingerprint software works flawlessly and is robust. The fingerprint pad needs regular cleaning to function properly. The fingerprint reader allows login without others seeing passwords. The fingerprint reader is not compatible with Mozilla browser, only Internet Explorer. The fingerprint reader on the keyboard is useful and accurate. The fingerprint reader is unreliable at times. The fingerprint reader does not allow domain login. The mouse and keyboard work but the fingerprint reader does not function properly.
The keyboard has a nice typing feel, not too mushy nor clicky.
cont.entity_b: The keyboard has a laptop-like feel but is full-sized. The keys have a nice feel and the keyboard is solid. The keyboard is quiet and easy to use. The keyboard is light and compact with a nice touch.

cont.entity_a: The wireless mouse fits well in hand and is simple without side buttons. The wireless mouse design is not ergonomic for some users. The mouse locks up and requires unplugging to reset.
cont.entity_b: The mouse is small and might be uncomfortable for some users. The mouse works well on various surfaces.

cont.entity_a: The special intellikeys need to be pressed too hard and the top of the keyboard bends slightly. The volume control keys are particularly bad. The keyboard has a standard layout. The keyboard and mouse are not wireless as described; only the mouse is wireless.
cont.entity_b: The detachable keypad is a great feature for limited desk space. The keypad has date, time, and temperature readings. The spacebar sticks, causing typing issues. The keyboard layout is different and buttons are labeled in Spanish. The keyboard and MediaPad creak and feel loosely put together. The num pad is useful and doubles as a calculator with clock and temp read-out. The keyboard and mouse connect easily and have sensitive, accurate response. The spacebar problem is common with this model. The keyboard is not suitable for KVM setups with PS/2 inputs.

cont.entity_a: The product lacks drivers for Windows 10, limiting functionality. The product is a great time saver by remembering multiple passwords. The product uses two USB ports instead of one. The keyboard and fingerprint reader are not compatible with 64-bit systems. The product is not Vista compatible out of the box.
cont.entity_b: The MediaPad consumes a lot of batteries with no option to turn it off. The mouse and number pad have power switches to conserve battery life. The product works well overall but has some key recognition issues.
The Bluetooth dongle may be dropped and not recognized by Windows.
